summary: In this context, 2-methoxy-2-methylpropane (MTBE) is mentioned as a component of gasoline produced by petroleum companies, which also contains other volatile organic compounds like benzene and toluene. The study focuses on the exposure to these compounds during commutes, indicating that MTBE is derived from petroleum products, but does not elaborate on any specific health effects or interactions between MTBE and petroleum beyond their association in gasoline formulations.
